thread.title: Justin Timberlake Opens 2017 Oscars With Lively 'Can't Stop the Feeling!' Performance: Watch
thread.title_full: Justin Timberlake Opens 2017 Oscars With Lively 'Can't Stop the Feeling!' Performance: Watch

title: Justin Timberlake Opens 2017 Oscars With Lively 'Can't Stop the Feeling!' Performance: Watch
text: Tweet Share Justin Timberlake performs in the audience at the Oscars on Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017, at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) More Even if Justin Timberlake doesn't take home his first Oscar tonight (Feb. 26), he can leave knowing he completely dominated the Oscars stage. Opening the show with his Trolls​ track -- and best original song nominee -- "Can't Stop the Feeling!," Timberlake brought the crowd to their feet right off the bat and began the night with a bang (even giving his former Mickey Mouse Club​ cohort Ryan Gosling a hug along the way). Starting the performance in the front corridor of the Dolby Theatre and dancing his way down the stairs to the stage, Timberlake continued the grooving with a hoard of backup dancers behind him. He even put a new spin on the chart-topping tune, adding in slight variations in his vocals as well as an R&B breakdown -- including a little Bill Withers "Lovely Day" excerpt. After delivering quite the crowd-pleasing, colorful performance, Timberlake ended his show opener in perhaps the most adorable way possible: a sweet smooch with wife Jessica Biel (cue the awws). Watch a clip of Timberlake's flawless "Can't Stop the Feeling" performance above.
